meanings.definition: Wetters: a person or thing that wets
meanings.sent1: The wetters in the garden hose made the plants happy.
meanings.sent2: The wetters sprayed water on the flowers to help them grow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous wetters turned on the sprinklers during the picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a group of joyful wetters, spreading happiness everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The little boy imagined tiny wetters dancing on the raindrops.

meanings.definition: Wetters: those who make something wet
meanings.sent1: The wetters with water guns soaked everyone at the water fight.
meanings.sent2: The wetters by the pool splashed water on each other playfully.
meanings.sent3: The wetters accidentally spilled juice all over the tablecloth.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were like giant wetters, pouring rain on the city.
meanings.sent5: The ocean waves crashed against the shore like powerful wetters.

meanings.definition: Wetters: those who cause something to become wet
meanings.sent1: The wetters left the windows open during the rainstorm.
meanings.sent2: The wetters forgot to close the umbrella, so it got wet in the storm.
meanings.sent3: The wetters left the ice cream out, and it melted into a puddle.
meanings.sent4: The wetters of the morning dew painted the grass with glistening droplets.
meanings.sent5: The wetters of the waterfall created a refreshing mist in the air.
